Our Commercial Development teams focus on generating non-fare related revenue for the organisation covering commercial partnerships, advertising and retail and property development. We have ambitious plans to generate £1.9bn by 2021, which we will reinvest into upgrading our network and services. We own a 5,700 acre estate that includes land and properties with huge potential for creating the homes and jobs that the Capital needs. Our property portfolio includes arches, residential and retail.  You will learn to manage properties in many settings which include traditional, secondary and tertiary parades as well as managing property in the more unique setting of a station.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What you'll be doing"}

As a graduate, your two year development programme will be made up of up to four placement rotations. Our aim is to equip you with the range of skills and experience you need for your successful career. We also understand that everyone's career is different, so every graduate's journey is unique.
Here's an idea of what your first year on the scheme could look like:
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Year 1"}

Placement 1 - Commercial Property Management - 6 months Focused on the renewal of excluded and protected leases, you will be undertaking the rent reviews, lease assignments, licences to alter, inspections and measurements. You will also maintain and observe the Health and Safety regulations and manage the maintenance of the building using a service charge budget.

Placement 2 - Commercial Asset Management - 6 months You will undertake asset strategies and projects, including refurbishments and unit amalgamation, lettings, market liaison, valuations, business planning, budgeting and associated place making aligned to our customer strategy.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Year 2"}

Placement 2 - Commercial Property Development - 6 months
You will carry out development appraisals, including carrying out inspections and measurements for the purpose of valuation. A primary role will also involve working within planning regulations and policies. You will receive training on the valuation tool Argus.

Placement 3 - CD Operational Group or CD Development - 6 months
Depending on your APC pathway, you gain experience in rating or CPO. In addition, you will liaise with third party surveyors on dilapidations, service charges, inspections and measurements. You will get the unique experience of acting as agent for both landlord and tenant.

Your first placement will be fixed and your following placements will be mutually agreed to ensure you gain experience on the widest possible range of technologies, tools and teams. In your second year, you will have the opportunity to tailor your time with us to suit your needs.  Your final placement will be in the chosen team which you would like to roll-off into.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we look for"}

Everything we do as an organisation is to ensure that our evolving city remains future-proof for millions of Londoners. Our talented graduates form a vital part of that vision, so it's important that we find the best people to help us do this.
We're looking for people who:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Take accountability for their work and are flexible when dealing with the unexpected","Have a desire to keep learning, be organised and with good attention to detail","Relish a challenge, with enthusiasm and drive that enjoy working with people"]}

As a member of the team, we'll give you responsibility and the opportunity to add value from day one.  If you are excited by inspiring and influencing the future of London and are up for a challenge and thrive under pressure, then this is the career path for you.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Where you can take your career"}

Property provides a fantastic opportunity to make a difference using your own skill set. There are many avenues to pursue and a myriad of options depending on the choices you take and the work you choose to get involved with. At TfL, we provide the opportunity to gain qualifications and develop a career in the property world through our diverse teams including Property Management, Asset Management, Lease & Letting, Lease Renewals & Rent Reviews, Development Appraisals for large projects, CPO work and project feasibility across all asset types including office, retail, residential and industrial.

Upon completing the scheme, your immediate progression will include support to gain your qualifications (APC), rotations within four departments and roll off into a team on successful acquisition of your Assessment of Professional Competence,

In five years, our successful graduates will work towards becoming a Senior Surveyor or Development Manager and will be developing their leadership, technical and professional skills through on the job training.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"How we'll develop and support you"}

Whilst on the scheme, we'll support your technical development through a wide range of on-the-job practical experiences and placements.  We'll also support your professional development through a combination of classroom-led training courses, online training courses, mentoring opportunities and structured networking opportunities with scheme alumni. You will receive one-to-one support throughout the programme from your scheme sponsor and your Line Manager. You'll also be connected to a 'buddy' who will be an alumnus from the scheme.

The course will include TfL's preferred APC course such as, 'The Kingston course'. You will receive support from a committed team of RICS accredited individual who will help and advise you through the process.
